problem_text:
A skew brace is a set B equipped with two operations + and · such that (B, +) is an additively written (but not necessarily abelian) group, (B, ·) is a multiplicatively written group, and a · (b + c) = ab − a + ac for any a, b, c ∈ B.
Let A be a skew brace with left-orderable multiplicative group. Is the additive group of A left-orderable?
V. Lebed, L. Vendramin
answer: No, not always (T. Nasybullov, J. Algebra, 540 (2019), 156–167).
